triples.name: Unmanned surface vehicle
triples.relevance: ASVs are the primary subject of coordinated control in this survey paper.

triples.name: Motion control
triples.relevance: Core method for controlling ASV movements discussed throughout the survey.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Framework for understanding coordinated control of multiple ASVs as multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Collision avoidance system
triples.relevance: Critical safety requirement for fleet formation and collision avoidance in ASV coordination.

triples.name: Autonomous underwater vehicle
triples.relevance: Related autonomous vehicle system mentioned for future task-region-oriented coordination research.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Computational method for trajectory and path planning in coordinated ASV control.

triples.name: Trajectory optimization
triples.relevance: Mathematical approach for designing optimal trajectories in trajectory-guided control of ASVs.

triples.name: Optimal control
triples.relevance: Theoretical foundation for optimization-based coordination methods discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Networked control system
triples.relevance: Addresses network-based coordination challenges and bandwidth constraints in ASV fleets.

triples.name: Adaptive collaborative control
triples.relevance: Framework for coordinated control where multiple ASVs work together as collaborative agents sharing decision-making responsibilities.
